definition: Li (c. 2000 BC), sixth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God, also known as Ai 哀[Ai1]

sentences.english: Rib meat sheep will be washed, cut into 4 cm square block.
sentences.chinese: 将羊肋条肉洗净，切成4厘米见方的块。

sentences.english: The total diameter of cavitation, if present, is less than 4cm.
sentences.chinese: 若出现空洞，其直径总和小于4厘米。

sentences.english: The rafters, spaced at approximately 80cm centers, are nailed to the purlin.
sentences.chinese: 椽子钉在连系梁上，中心间距为80厘米。

sentences.english: The dog's height should not exceed 40 cm, weight 10 kg.
sentences.chinese: 狗的身高不能超过40厘米，体重在10公斤以下。

sentences.english: How much does one cubic foot of air weigh at 0℃ and 76 cm. pressure?
sentences.chinese: 一立方英尺空气在0℃和76厘米汞柱压力下重多少？

sentences.english: And now you get separation on the order of centimeters.
sentences.chinese: 现在可能分开到厘米的程度。

sentences.english: Cut the dowel down to 20cm in length.
sentences.chinese: 削减木钉，以20厘米的长度。

sentences.english: Underneath their fur, polar bears have an additional 10-cm-layer of fat, called blubber.
sentences.chinese: 在毛皮的下面还有一层十厘米厚的脂肪，名为鲸脂。

sentences.english: Amount of day precipitations in in, cm or mm.
sentences.chinese: 每天以英寸，厘米，毫米的降雨量。

sentences.english: His longest nail is 35cm (14ins) long and prevents him from making his hand into a fist.
sentences.chinese: 现在他最长的指甲已有35厘米，这使他无法攥拳头。

sentences.english: No one had ever heard of anyone using Propofol in a bedroom EVER until CM.
sentences.chinese: 没有人曾经听说过有人异丙酚在卧室里曾经直到厘米。

sentences.english: The shore diminishes 3 to 4 cm each year: it's hopeless, " says the scientist.
sentences.chinese: 海岸每年缩减3至4厘米，已经没救了”。

sentences.english: The tube is 18 centimeters long, with finger holes still evident.
sentences.chinese: 古笛长18厘米，笛上的指孔依然可见。

sentences.english: Inflorescence racemose to 7 cm at fructification , densely yellow pubescent.
sentences.chinese: 总状的花序达7厘米在果期，密被黄色短柔毛。

sentences.english: Take out 4 ribands about 40 centimeters long.
sentences.chinese: 拿出四条大约40厘米的丝带。

definition: chi (Chinese unit of length equal to ⅓ meter)
a Chinese foot/one-third of a meter/a ruler/a tape-measure/one of the three acupoints for measuring pulse in Chinese medicine/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3]
one of the characters used to represent a musical note in gongche notation, 工尺譜|工尺谱[gong1 che3 pu3]
thick/deep or profound/kind/generous/rich or strong in flavor/to favor/to stress
foot (unit of length equal to 0.3048 m)
a (10 meter) square/a square of given side
